page.title: 17Education in West Farnham
page.content: Schools in Surrey are organised on a 3-tier basis, as follows: {Primary}: First Schools for ages 5-8 years; Middle Schools for ages 8-12; {Secondary}: Schools and Sixth Form Colleges for 12-18 year olds. {This D-Block}is served by Wrecclesham St.Peter's Church of England Middle School, St.Andrews C.of E. First and St.Andrews C.of E. Middle Schools. Many pupils transfer to{Weydon County {Secondary}the only State secondary school in the area. The number of pupils of secondary school age is falling. In 1984/5 270 children were admitted to Weydon, giving a total of over 950 on roll. In 1985/6 only 205 new pupils will join the school, giving a total of about 885 on roll. Farnham Art College and the Institute of Adult Education provide{Further {Education}in this D-Block.
